intro: Randia pittieri, commonly known as the Mexican redroot, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its opposite, simple leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink, followed by red, fleshy berries. Randia pittieri is often found in dry, rocky soils and can thrive in full sun to partial shade. It is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in local medicine.
